original: ardhamāsikaṃ snātram anyatra samayāt tadatikrāmataḥ pātayantikā tatrāyaṃ samayaḥ
analyzed: ardha māsikam snātram anyatra samayāt tat atikrāmataḥ pātayantikā tatra ayam samayaḥ
translated: Bathing every half-month, except on special occasions, is a pātayantika. The special occasions are:

original: sārdho māsaḥ śeṣo grīṣmasya pūrvo māso varṣāṇām etau sārdhau dvau māsau paridāghasamayaḥ
analyzed: sārdhaḥ māsaḥ śeṣaḥ grīṣmasya pūrvaḥ māsaḥ varṣāṇām etau sārdhau dvau māsau paridāgha samayaḥ
translated: The last half-month of summer and the first half-month of the rainy season, these two and a half months are the hot season.

original: avaśiṣṭaṃ glānasamayaḥ karmasamayo vātasamayo vṛṣṭisamayo 'dhvānamārgasamayo 'yaṃ tatra samayaḥ //
analyzed: avaśiṣṭam glāna samayaḥ karma samayaḥ vāta samayaḥ vṛṣṭi samayaḥ dhvāna mārga samayaḥ yam tatra samayaḥ
translated: The remaining time is the sick season, the work season, the wind season, the rain season, the road journey season. This is the special occasion there.

original: yaḥ punar bhikṣuḥ saṃcintya tīryagyonigataṃ prāṇinaṃ jīvitād vyaparopayet pātayantikā
analyzed: yaḥ punar bhikṣuḥ saṃcintya tīryagyoni gatam prāṇinam jīvitāt vyaparopayet pātayantikā
translated: If a monk, with a malicious mind, were to deprive a living being belonging to the animal realm of life, it is a pāyattika.

original: yaḥ punar bhikṣur bhikṣoḥ saṃcintya kaukṛtyam upasaṃhared viheṭhanāprekṣī kaccid asya bhikṣor muhūrtam api tāvad aphāṣaṃ bhaved idam eva pratyayaṃ
analyzed: yaḥ punar bhikṣuḥ bhikṣoḥ saṃcintya kaukṛtyam upasaṃharet viheṭhana a prekṣī kaccit asya bhikṣoḥ muhūrtam api tāvat a phāṣam bhavet idam eva pratyayam
translated: If a monk, with a malicious mind, were to cause remorse in a monk, thinking to harm him, [thinking] 'Perhaps this monk will have a moment of unhappiness,'

original: kṛtvā nānyathā pātayantikā 🔽aṅgulipratodanāt pātayantikā
analyzed: kṛtvā na anyathā pātayantikā  aṅguli pratodanāt pātayantikā
translated: having made this the reason, not otherwise, it is a pāyattika.🔽For poking with a finger, it is a pāyattika.

original: udakaharṣaṇāt pātayantikā
analyzed: udaka harṣaṇāt pātayantikā
translated: For agitating water, it is a pāyattika.

original: yaḥ punar bhikṣur mātṛgrāmeṇa sārdhaṃ sahāgāraśayyāṃ kalpayet pātayantikā
analyzed: yaḥ punar bhikṣuḥ mātṛgrāmeṇa sārdham saha āgāra śayyām kalpayet pātayantikā
translated: If a monk were to arrange to sleep in the same room as a woman, it is a pāyattika.

original: yaḥ punar bhikṣur bhikṣuṃ bhīṣayed bhīṣāpayed vā antato hāsyaprekṣyam api pātayantikā
analyzed: yaḥ punar bhikṣuḥ bhikṣum bhīṣayet bhīṣāpayet vā antatas hāsya prekṣyam api pātayantikā
translated: If a monk were to frighten a monk, or cause him to be frightened, even for the sake of amusement, it is a pāyattika.

original: yaḥ punar bhikṣur bhikṣoḥ pātraṃ vā cīvaraṃ vā kuñcikaṃ vā upānahaṃ vā sūcīgharakaṃ
analyzed: yaḥ punar bhikṣuḥ bhikṣoḥ pātram vā cīvaram vā kuñcikam vā upānaham vā sūcī gharakam
translated: If a monk were to keep or cause to be kept a monk's bowl, robe, key, sandals, needle case,

original: vā anyatamānyatamaṃ vā śrāmaṇakaṃ pariṣkāram upanidadhyād upanidhāpayed vā antato
analyzed: vā anyatama anyatamam vā śrāmaṇakam pariṣkāram upanidadhyāt upanidhāpayet vā
translated: or any other requisite of a monastic, even

original: hāsyaprekṣyam api pātayantikā
analyzed: hāsya prekṣyam api pātayantikā
translated: for the sake of amusement, it is a pāyattika.

original: yaḥ punar bhikṣur bhikṣoḥ pātraṃ vā cīvaram vā datt🔽vā tataḥ paścād apratyuddhārya paribhuṃjīta pātayantikā
analyzed: yaḥ punar bhikṣuḥ bhikṣoḥ pātram vā cīvaram vā datt  vā tatas paścāt a pratyuddhārya paribhuṃjīta pātayantikā
translated: If a monk, having given a bowl or robe to a monk, should later use it without having taken it back, it is a pāyantika.

original: yaḥ punar bhikṣur bhikṣum amūlakena saṃghāvaśeṣeṇa dharmeṇānudhvaṃsayet pātayantikā🔽yaḥ punar bhikṣur mātṛgrāmeṇa sārdhaṃ saṃvidhāya samānamārgaṃ pratipadyeta antato grāmāntaram api pātayantikā //
analyzed: yaḥ punar bhikṣuḥ bhikṣum amūlakena saṃgha avaśeṣeṇa dharmeṇa anudhvaṃsayet pātayantikā  yaḥ punar bhikṣuḥ mātṛgrāmeṇa sārdham saṃvidhāya samāna mārgam pratipadyeta antatas grāma antaram api pātayantikā  /
translated: If a monk, without grounds, should accuse a monk of an offense entailing suspension, it is a pāyantika.🔽If a monk should travel by appointment with a woman, even just to the next village, it is a pāyantika.

original: yaḥ punar bhikṣuḥ steyasārthena sārdhaṃ saṃvidhāya samānamārgaṃ pratipadyeta antato grāmāntaram api pātayantikā
analyzed: yaḥ punar bhikṣuḥ steya sārthena sārdham saṃvidhāya samāna mārgam pratipadyeta antatas grāma antaram api pātayantikā
translated: If a monk should travel by appointment with a group of thieves, even just to the next village, it is a pāyantika.

original: yaḥ punar bhikṣur ūnaviṃśativarṣaṃ pudgalaṃ bhikṣubhāvenopasaṃpādayet pātayantikā sa ca pudgalo 'nupasaṃpannas te ca bhikṣavo garhyā iyaṃ tatra 🔽sāmīciḥ
analyzed: yaḥ punar bhikṣuḥ ūnaviṃśati varṣam pudgalam bhikṣu bhāvena upasaṃpādayet pātayantikā sa ca pudgalaḥ n upasaṃpannaḥ te ca bhikṣavaḥ garhyāḥ iyam tatra  sāmīciḥ
translated: If a monk should give full ordination to a person less than twenty years old, it is a pāyantika. That person is not fully ordained, and those monks are to be reproved. This is the proper procedure there.

original: yaḥ punar bhikṣuḥ pṛthivīṃ khanyāt khānayed vā pātayantikā
analyzed: yaḥ punar bhikṣuḥ pṛthivīm khanyāt khānayet vā pātayantikā
translated: If a monk should dig the earth or have it dug, it is a pāyantika.

original: caturmāsikā bhikṣuṇā pravāraṇā sādhayitavyā anyatra nityapravāraṇāyā anyatra punaḥpunaḥpravāraṇāyā anyatra pratyekapravāraṇāyā tata uttaraṃ
analyzed: caturmāsikā bhikṣuṇā pravāraṇā sādhayitavyā anyatra nitya pravāraṇāyāḥ anyatra punar punar pravāraṇāyāḥ anyatra pratyeka pravāraṇāyāḥ tatas uttaram
translated: A monk should perform the poṣadha every four months, except for the regular poṣadha, except for the repeated poṣadha, except for the individual poṣadha. If he performs it more than that,

original: sādhayet pātayantikā
analyzed: sādhayet pātayantikā
translated: he commits a pāyantika.

original: yaḥ punar bhikṣur bhikṣubhir ucyamāna iha te śikṣāyāṃ śikṣitavyam ity evaṃ vaden
analyzed: yaḥ punar bhikṣuḥ bhikṣubhiḥ ucyamānaḥ iha te śikṣāyām śikṣitavyam iti evam vaden
translated: If a monk, when told by the monks, “Here you should train in this training,” says

original: nāhaṃ yuṣmākaṃ bālānāṃ mūḍhānāṃ duṣprajñānāṃ vacanenātra śikṣāyāṃ śikṣiṣyāmi anyān
analyzed: na aham yuṣmākam bālānām mūḍhānām duṣprajñānām vacanena atra śikṣāyām śikṣiṣyāmi anyān
translated: “I will not train in this training because of the words of you who are foolish, ignorant, and unwise. I will ask other monks

original: ahaṃ bhikṣūṃ prakṣyāmi sūtradharān vinayadharān mātṛkādharān iti pātayantikā /
analyzed: aham bhikṣūm prakṣyāmi sūtradharān vinaya dharān mātṛkādharān iti pātayantikā
translated: who are experts in the sūtras, experts in the Vinaya, and experts in the mātikās,” he commits a pāyantika.

original: ājñātukāmena bhikṣuṇā tatra śikṣāyāṃ śikṣitavyaṃ bhikṣavaś ca praṣṭavyāḥ sūtradharā vinayadharā mātṛkādharāḥ /
analyzed: ājñātu kāmena bhikṣuṇā tatra śikṣāyām śikṣitavyam bhikṣavaḥ ca praṣṭavyāḥ sūtra dharāḥ vinaya dharāḥ mātṛkā dharāḥ
translated: A monk who wishes to understand should train in that training and should ask the monks who are experts in the sūtras, experts in the Vinaya, and experts in the mātikās.

original: iyaṃ tatra sāmīciḥ
analyzed: iyam tatra sāmīciḥ
translated: This is the proper conduct in that case.

original: yaḥ punar bhikṣur bhikṣūṇāṃ kalahajātānāṃ bhaṇḍanajātānāṃ vigṛhītānāṃ vivādam āpannānāṃ
analyzed: yaḥ punar bhikṣuḥ bhikṣūṇām kalaha jātānām bhaṇḍana jātānām vigṛhītānām vivādam āpannānām
translated: If a monk, when the monks are quarreling, fighting, and disputing,

original: tūṣṇīm upaśrutikas tiṣṭhed yad ete bhikṣavo vakṣyanti tad ahaṃ śrutvā tathānuvyāhariṣyāmīti pātayantikā 🔽yaḥ punar bhikṣuḥ saṃghasya ni
analyzed: tūṣṇīm upaśrutikaḥ tiṣṭhet yat ete bhikṣavaḥ vakṣyanti tat aham śrutvā tathā anuvyāhariṣyāmi iti pātayantikā  yaḥ punar bhikṣuḥ saṃghasya ni
translated: If a monk, when a legal issue is being discussed in the Sangha, gets up from his seat and leaves while there is still more to be done, except on an occasion when there is a reason, he commits a pāyantika.

original: ścitāyāṃ kathāyāṃ vartamānāyāṃ tūṣṇīm utthāya prakramet saṃtaṃ bhikṣum anavalokya pātayantikā
analyzed: ścitāyām kathāyām vartamānāyām tūṣṇīm utthāya prakramet saṃtam bhikṣum an avalokya pātayantikā
translated: If a monk, when a legal issue is being discussed in the Sangha, gets up from his seat and leaves without informing a monk who is present, except on an occasion when there is a reason, he commits a pāyantika.

original: anādareyakāt pātayantikā
analyzed: an ādareyakāt pātayantikā
translated: (The rule) about disrespecting is a pāyantika.

original: surāmaireyamadyapānāt pātayantikā
translated: (The rule) about drinking alcohol is a pāyantika.

original: yaḥ punar bhikṣur akāle grāmaṃ praviśet santaṃ bhikṣum anavalokyānyatra tathārūpapratyayāt pātayantikā //🔽yaḥ punar bhikṣuḥ sabhaktaṃ /
analyzed: yaḥ punar bhikṣuḥ akāle grāmam praviśet santam bhikṣum an avalokya anyatra tathārūpa pratyayāt pātayantikā  / yaḥ punar bhikṣuḥ sabhaktam
translated: If a monk enters a village at the wrong time without informing a monk who is present, except on an occasion when there is a reason, he commits a pāyantika.

original: kuleṣūpanimantritaḥ pūrvabhaktaṃ paścādbhaktaṃ kuleṣu cāritram āpadyeta pātayantikā🔽yaḥ punar bhikṣu rājñaḥ kṣatriyasya mūrdhābhiṣiktasya aniṣk
analyzed: kuleṣu upanimantritaḥ pūrva bhaktam paścāt bhaktam kuleṣu cāritram āpadyeta pātayantikā  yaḥ punar bhikṣu rājñaḥ kṣatriyasya mūrdhābhiṣiktasya a niṣkram
translated: If a monk, having accepted a meal invitation, goes to another house for food before or after that meal, except on an occasion when there is a reason, he commits a pāyantika.🔽If a monk, when the king, a kshatriya who has been anointed, has not left,

original: rānte rājñi
analyzed: ra ante rājñi
translated: when the royal treasures have not been put away,

original: anirgṛhīteṣu ratneṣu indrakīlaṃ vā indrakīlabhūmiṃ vā samatikramed anyatra tathārūpapratyayāt pātayantikā
analyzed: a nirgṛhīteṣu ratneṣu indrakīlam vā indrakīla bhūmim vā samatikramet anyatra tathārūpa pratyayāt pātayantikā
translated: goes beyond the threshold or the threshold area, except on an occasion when there is a reason, he commits a pāyantika.

original: yaḥ punar bhikṣuḥ prātimokṣasūtroddiśyamāne evaṃ vaded idānīm ahaṃ jānāmi yad ayaṃ🔽dharmaḥ sūtragataḥ sūtraparyāpanna iti taṃ ca bhikṣavo jānīyuḥ saṃniṣaṇṇapūrvo 'yam
analyzed: yaḥ punar bhikṣuḥ prātimokṣa sūtra uddiśyamāne evam vadet idānīm aham jānāmi yat ayam  dharmaḥ sūtra gataḥ sūtra paryāpannaḥ iti tam ca bhikṣavaḥ jānīyuḥ saṃniṣaṇṇa pūrvaḥ yam
translated: But if a monk, when the Prātimokṣa is being recited, should say, “Now I know that this rule of training

original: āyuṣmāṃ dvis triḥ prātimokṣasūtroddeśe kaḥ punar vādo bhūya iti tasya punar bhikṣor nāsty ajñānān mokṣo
analyzed: āyuṣmān dvis tris prātimokṣa sūtra uddeśe kaḥ punar vādaḥ bhūyas iti tasya punar bhikṣoḥ na asti ajñānāt mokṣaḥ
translated: has been laid down by the Lord, the Tathāgata, the Arhan, the perfect Buddha,” and if the monks should know that this venerable one has been sitting in the assembly for two or three times the recitation of the Prātimokṣa, how much more so for more than that, then that monk, having no knowledge,

original: yāṃ cāpattim āpannaḥ syāt tāṃ yathādharmaṃ kārayitavya uttarañ ca saṃvejayitavyas
analyzed: yām ca āpattim āpannaḥ syāt tām yathādharmam kārayitavyaḥ uttaram ca saṃvejayitavyaḥ
translated: is not released from that offense. Whatever offense he has fallen into, he should be dealt with according to the rule. And he should be reproved thus:

original: tasya te āyuṣmann alābho na lābhaḥ durlabdho na sulabdhaḥ yo hi nāma tvam anvardhamāsaṃ
analyzed: tasya te āyuṣman alābhaḥ na lābhaḥ durlabdhaḥ na sulabdhaḥ yaḥ hi nāma tvam
translated: “This is a loss to you, venerable one, not a gain, a bad gain, not a good gain, in that you, when the Prātimokṣa is being recited every half month,

original: prātimokṣasūtroddiśyamāne na satkṛtyārthīkṛtvā na gurukṛtvā na manasīkṛtvā naikāgracitto
analyzed: prātimokṣa sūtra uddiśyamāne na satkṛtya arthīkṛtvā na gurukṛtvā na manasīkṛtvā na ekāgra cittaḥ
translated: do not listen with a mind bent on learning, with a mind of reverence, with a mind of respect, with a one-pointed mind,

original: nāvahitaśrotro na sarvacetasā samanvāhṛtya śṛṇoṣi iyaṃ tasya saṃvejanāt pātayantikā
analyzed: na avahita śrotraḥ na sarva cetasā samanvāhṛtya śṛṇoṣi iyam tasya saṃvejanāt pātayantikā
translated: with ears inclined, with all your mind bent on hearing—this is the reproving for him.

original: yaḥ punar bhikṣur asthimayaṃ dantamayaṃ viṣāṇamayaṃ vā sūcīgharakaṃ kārayet pātayantikā
analyzed: yaḥ punar bhikṣuḥ asthi mayam danta mayam viṣāṇa mayam vā sūcīgharakam kārayet pātayantikā
translated: If a monk again has a needle case made of bone, ivory, or horn, it is a pāyantika.

original: pīṭhaṃ vā bhikṣuṇā mañcaṃ vā kārayatā sugatāṣṭāṅgulipramāṇāḥ pādāḥ kārayitavyā anyatrāraṇyās tata uttaraṃ kārayet pātayantikā
analyzed: pīṭham vā bhikṣuṇā mañcam vā kārayatā sugata aṣṭa aṅguli pramāṇāḥ pādāḥ kārayitavyāḥ anyatra āraṇyāḥ tatas uttaram kārayet pātayantikā
translated: If a monk is having a seat or a bed made, he should have legs that are eight standard fingerbreadths of the Sugata in length, except in the case of a wilderness dwelling. If he has it made longer than that, it is a pāyantika.

original: yaḥ punar bhikṣus tūlasaṃstṛtāṃ śayyām avanahed avanāhayed vā pātayantikā
analyzed: yaḥ punar bhikṣuḥ tūla saṃstṛtām śayyām avanahet avanāhayet vā pātayantikā
translated: If a monk spreads out or has spread out a bed that is stuffed with cotton, it is a pāyantika.

original: varṣāśāṭīcīvaraṃ bhikṣuṇā kārayatā prāmāṇikaṃ kārayitavyaṃ tatredaṃ pramāṇaṃ dīrghataḥ ṣaḍ vitastayaḥ sugatavitastyā tīryak sārdhe dve tata
analyzed: varṣā śāṭī cīvaram bhikṣuṇā kārayatā prāmāṇikam kārayitavyam tatra idam pramāṇam dīrghataḥ ṣaḍ vitastayaḥ sugata vitastyā tīryak sārdhe dve tata
translated: If a monk is having a rains-residence cloak made, he should have it made the right size. The right size is: six standard Sugata-spans in length and two and a half across.

original: uttaraṃ kārayet pātayantikā
analyzed: uttaram kārayet pātayantikā
translated: If he has it made larger than that, it is a pāyantika.

original: kaṇḍupraticchādanaṃ bhikṣuṇā kārayatā prāmāṇikaṃ kārayitavyaṃ tatredaṃ pramāṇaṃ dīrghataś catasro vitastayaḥ sugatavitastyā tīryag dve tata
analyzed: kaṇḍu praticchādanam bhikṣuṇā kārayatā prāmāṇikam kārayitavyam tatra idam pramāṇam dīrghataḥ catasraḥ vitastayaḥ sugata vitastyā tīryak dve tata
translated: If a monk is having an itch-covering cloth made, he should have it made the right size. The right size is: four standard Sugata-spans in length and two across.

original: uttaraṃ kārayet pātayantikā
analyzed: uttaram kārayet pātayantikā
translated: If he has it made larger than that, it is a pāyantika.

original: niṣīdanaṃ bhikṣuṇā kārayatā prāmāṇikaṃ kārayitavyaṃ tatredaṃ pramāṇaṃ dīrghato vitastī
analyzed: niṣīdanam bhikṣuṇā kārayatā prāmāṇikam kārayitavyam tatra idam pramāṇam dīrghataḥ vitastī
translated: When a monk is having a sitting mat made, he should have it made the right size. The right size is this: two standard handspans long

original: dve sugatavitastyā tīryak sārdhavitastir daśānāṃ ca vitastis tata uttaraṃ kārayet pātayantikā
analyzed: dve sugata vitastyā tīryak sārdha vitastiḥ daśānām ca vitastiḥ tatas uttaram kārayet pātayantikā
translated: and one and a half wide. Ten standard handspans in circumference. If he has one made larger than that, it is to be forfeited.

original: yaḥ punar bhikṣuḥ sugatacīvarapramāṇena cīvaraṃ kārayed uttaraṃ vā sugatacīvarāt pātayantikā /
analyzed: yaḥ punar bhikṣuḥ sugata cīvara pramāṇena cīvaram kārayet uttaram vā sugata cīvarāt pātayantikā
translated: If a monk has a robe made the size of the standard robe of the Blessed One, or larger, it is to be forfeited.🔽The standard robe of the Blessed One is this: nine standard handspans long

original: tatredaṃ sugatacīvarapramāṇaṃ dīrghato nava vitastayaḥ sugatavitastyā tīryak ṣaḍ idaṃ tatra sugatacīvarapramāṇaṃ //
analyzed: tatra idam sugata cīvara pramāṇam dīrghatas nava vitastayaḥ sugata vitastyā tīryak ṣaṣ idam tatra sugata cīvara pramāṇam
translated: and six wide. This is the standard robe of the Blessed One.

original: uddiṣṭā mayāyuṣmanto navati pātayantikā dharmās tatrāham āyuṣmataḥ pṛcchāmi kaccit sthātra pariśuddhā dvir api trir api pṛcchāmi kaccit sthātra🔽śuddhā pariśu
